name: Hotel-Pension Bloberger Hof

reviews.title: I always have something to remark
reviews.text: Bloberger Hof is the exception to the rule. The hotel is conveniently located, close to the highway, to Salzburg city center and still in the middle of nature. The warm reception , the room ( with a nice balcony ) and breakfast were all perfect. We had a relaxing swim in the nearby ( 5K) outdoor Leopoldskron swimming pool. A real recommendation!
We chose Bloberger Hof from all the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor and were essentially happy with our choice.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: The location was actually ideal - we enjoyed being away from the city - was picturesque for my early morning jogs - and the bus trip into town was very convenient and quick.
reviews.title: Best Breakfast in Austria

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the breakfast very tasty.
reviews.title: Memorable stay

reviews.text: 2 negatives - our room I believe was directly above the kitchen of the restaurant, and each night there was a lot of very loud clattering of pots pans and dishes that kept me from sleeping til after 10pm each night.
reviews.title: Nice place - good if you have car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bloberger Hof for five nights at the beginning of May, 2010 on our two week trip through Munich, Salzburg, and Hallstatt. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again. Our "Superior" room was very roomy, tastefully decorated, and had a scenic view of green hills. The best features of Bloberger Hof are its location in a quiet, serene, residential neighborhood, its excellent ground floor restaurant, and the large, comfortable room. We had a rental car so did not try the bus transportation into Altstadt (Old City). By car, it was an easy 10 minute drive to the Altstadt parking lot. It was also easy to access the A10 for the Eisriesenwelt Ice Caves, Hohenwerfen Castle, Golling Waterfalls, Konigssee, and Obersalzberg. We received a recommendation from the hotel to visit Gut Aiderbichl animal sanctuary, 20 minutes by car from Salzburg. It was not in any of the guide books but turned out to be one of the highlights of our stay. Bloberger Hof was our favorite hotel during our two week stay in Germany and Austria.
reviews.title: Serene location, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Wonderful view of the mountains from our room

reviews.text: large, comfortable "Superior" room with balcony and view
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, wonderful hotel, wonderful city

reviews.text: buffet breakfast with good selection and eggs cooked to order
reviews.title: Perfect Salzburg stop

reviews.text: hard working and friendly owner, Inge
reviews.title: Easy to see why this is #1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Bloberger Hof was truly delightful. When I made the reservation, the hotel only had superior rooms available. Unbeknownst to me, that meant that our room had a balcony that we could sit out on with a lovely view of the Alps. That added treat was worth the few Euro more that we had to pay.
reviews.title: Alpine Charm

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the outskirts of Vienna, in a small village of a little road, but has convenient bus transportation in and out of the city. The ride was never more than 20 minutes. It was certainly worth leaving the car in the hotel parking lot, which seemed extremely safe since the only people with access to the car would have been the customers at the hotel.
reviews.title: What a fantastic stay! Do not miss it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large with a sitting area and table for relaxation, as well as the balcony outside.
reviews.title: The hotel was worth the trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was large, with a large shower and included a hair dryer.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, friendly owners and delicious food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was completely non-smoking, one of the few who claimed such and actually held true to that feature.
reviews.title: traditional B&B, friendly but not anything special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the Bloberger hof. Sylvia was excellent as were all the staff. They all spoke excellent English. We booked a Category A room. It was absolutely huge. It had a seperate bedroom with a television. A sitting room with a television. A seperate WC and a seperate shower. Lovely wood ceilings and floors. It also had a balcony with great views and flower boxes.The room was absolutely spotless. We ate at the restaurant and the food was excellent. We also ate across from the hotel and found the food very good. There is a bus a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and ran every 15 mins until midnight. It costs 2 euros each way. The buffet breakfast was very good and was offered in a very nice room with plenty of windows. Would not hesitate to recommend this fine hotel to everyone I know.
reviews.title: Loved the room

reviews.text: My mom, brother, and I stayed at this hotel for two nights while sightseeing in Salzburg. It is absolutely charming! I have never stayed anywhere this darling.
reviews.title: Charming stay!

likes.disliked: — I did not like the bugs that attacked us!

reviews.text: The hotel/B&B is located in the "residential" area of Salzburg. There is a bus stop about a 2 min. walk from the hotel. The ride into the city is about 20 minutes. However, it is a bit pricey - 2 euro each way - but very convenient as it drops you right by Mozartplatz.
reviews.title: Nice & clean rooms, good location, decent breakfast

reviews.text: The hotel/B&B has free parking available and also free wireless internet in the category A rooms. My one complaint is the bugs. We had a few bees and mosquitoes in our rooms. However, there was a green plug thing in the room I think we could have plugged in and it would have kept the bugs away.
reviews.title: Austrian Family Hospitality at this Lovely Hotel
Loved the Blobergerhof
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious. We had one bedroom with a double bed and closet. Another room with extendable couch, kitchen table, sitting area, tv, sink, dishwasher, and more cabinents, and another room with another couch! We were quite surprised at how large it was! I would most definitely stay here again!!

What a beautiful place in a beautiful setting! The view outside our window was amazing - snow covered Alps in the early Spring. Place is immaculately clean, rooms were a decent size, they were very friendly. About a 25 minute bus ride to the old town, but the bus stop is just 1 minute from the house and you don't have to change buses. Wish we could have stayed longer and we will definitely stay there again if we go back to Salzburg.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place, Gorgeous View

reviews.text: This hotel is about a 20minute bus ride out of town. It has lovely views of snow covered mountains. Our family of 5 adults stayed in a double and triple room for 2 nights. The rooms were very well appointed. The Bloberger Hof is a family run hotel. The hospitality and service was excellent. The buffet breakfast was great as were the meals served at the restaurant during the evening.
reviews.title: Wonderful Accommodation

reviews.text: We wanted to stay one night in Salzburg in oder to do the Sound of Music tour and a Mozart concert, so I booked two rooms at the Blobergerhof, based on price mainly (it was much more reasonable than any of the places in downtown Salzburg). I was hoping that the rooms would be at least clean and adequate. Little did I imagine that we had found the true gem of our two week stay in Europe! What a splendid little place this is! A beautiful, rustic location, with stunning views (but only fifteen minutes or less from the center of Salzburg by car). Wonderful, professional management-- most friendly and accomodating. The cleanest rooms I've ever seen, and very charming, too. A wonderful breakfast in the morning (we were sorry not to be able to try the restaurant), with omelettes made to order! We mourned when we had to leave for Mittenwald, and cursed that we hadn't booked at least one more night in Salzburg! Then, on checking out, Inge, the innkeeper informed us that the rooms we had were "only" "standard" rooms (not deluxe as in our original reservation (could have fooled us-- they were large & charming, both)-- so she was refunding 15 euro per room to us! Talk about ethical; she could have charged us the full amount, and we still would have thought it a bargain. What an honest woman-- and charming, too! We've been back from Europe only a week-- but it's the Blobergerhof we miss the most! Highly recommended for anyone traveling to Salzburg!
reviews.title: I wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bloberger Hoff is possibly the best value hotel we have ever stayed at. On booking, after reading many good reviews,we decided upon a slightly higher than basic room, without booking the top rate. We arrived and walked into our 'room' to find a two floor apartment with living room, bedroom, large bathroom and balcony awaiting us! Great stuff!
reviews.title: Freindly, clean, spacious, great location, lovely views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the hotel restaurant twice; not a huge selection of things to eat but what they do have is perfectly nice. Breakfast is great with eggs made to order alongside the continental norms. Service was fantastic with a cheap mini bar in each room and reception desk help whenever you need it.
reviews.title: The highlight of Salzburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of location, Slazburg is a 5 minute drive away, the Eagle's nest 3/4 hour, lakes and mountains of salzburgerland less than that.
reviews.title: Good hotel - if you have a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely place, would recommend to anyone, much better than getting stuck in the city centre and losing interest in it fast, loads to do.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hospitality!

description: Our small but beautiful family-run 3-star hotel just outside of the Mozart city of Salzburg is surrounded by nature, yet is only 5 km from the historic centre. The main sights of Salzburg can be reached within 15 minutes by bus. Our stylishly furnished rooms offer great views of the Untersberg mountain or the Hohensalzburg Fortress. Enjoy a tasty dinner in our restaurant and let the day come to an end with a glass of wine in a friendly atmosphere. The hotel offers you the chance to relax and recharge your batteries, but is an ideal starting point for many sights as well.
